page.title: 08TRAQUAIR HOUSE
page.content: TRAQUAIR HOUSE HAS BEEN LIVED IN SINCE THE ELEVENTH CENTURY AND IN DAYS OF OLD, THE KINGS OF SCOTLAND CAME HERE TO HUNT WILD BEAR. APPROPRIATELY, A BEAR WAS CHOSEN TO HOLD THE FAMILY COAT OF ARM ON EITHER SIDE OF THE AVENUE GATES. IN 1745, BONNIE PRINCE CHARLIE CAME TO ASK THE EARL OF TRAQUAIR FOR HELP IN HIS PLANS TO CLAIM THE CROWN. THE EARL SENT HIS SON TO FIGHT WITH THE PRINCE AND WHEN THEY HAD GONE HE LOCKED THE BEAR GATES, DECLARING THAT THEY WOULD REMAIN UNOPENED UNTIL A STUART BECAME KING AND THUS THEY ARE STILL CLOSED TILL THIS DAY. OTHER FAMOUS "ROYALS" WHO HAVE STAYED AT THE TRAQUAIR HOUSE ARE MARY QUEEN OF SCOTS AND HER SON JAMES THE FIRST.
